comments.body: 1 BTC = ₦34000000₦21500000₦20000000₦35000000Source Buying a house with just 1 BTC depends on the location in my country. comments.author: leea-1334
comments.body: This is not my country,,, but I can be considered a resident here and to make a note, this is the most expensive country in Asia, minus Japan and South Korea.This is also not a post for what 1 BTC can buy (nothing useful) but to give an idea what it really can help you even in the most expensive country in Asia.For 1 BTC it is enough for a 5% downpayment on this property, for which you also get a matching government grant. For 90% of people,,, they cannot afford this but if you manage to put downpayment and grant that means you only have 90% to pay for 30 years.In 30 years it is likely your property doubles as land in Singapore is as everyone knows limited, and you for sure sell higher than you bought, all the time.But if you are smart,,, you buy a bit outside the city LANDED property for half the price.Meaning for 1 BTC you can get 20% of the house paid and pay off the land (extremely rare commodity) in tiny Singapore.

comments.author: bakasabo
comments.body: 1 Bitcoin is worth around 53,900 EUR on October 18.It will be quite difficult to turn 1 BTC into euro with a single operation. 100% it will be monitored by government and 20% income tax must be paid. Or you will lose around 10% after using "shady cash out" service. (it is impossible to pay directly with crypto)The best logical usage would be buying property. For 43-45k EUR it will be possible to get decent looking 1 room flat (about 40m2 in house like Khrushchyovka) with ikea like furniture, electrical appliances and etc. It will be a corner flat (these one are always cold or it will be often damp at home) or on the first floor.Or if you use a shady option, you might be lucky to get same type of flat, but with 2 rooms/higher floor/better furniture and electrical appliances. You might be lucky to get a 1 room flat in a new house like this.But it will be worse offer on the market. It will be a almost like a box on first floor with <30m2. No furniture, no electrical appliances, first floor.P.S. 1 room flat it does not mean "1 room + bedroom" (which is typical for US). It will be just 1 room and a kitchen.
